item.title: Additive color mix diagram
item.description: In this journey, I will try to recreate the additive color mix diagram in Blender. As usual, there are several possibilities. 1. Three colored spotlights The easiest solution is to create three spot lights. So, start Blender, delete the default cube and the light. Switch to top view; add three lights of type spotlight and a plane. Figure 1: Blender setup for the three colored spot-lights solution Switch to top view.

item.title: FFMPEG useful commands
item.description: FFMPEG is a command line tool for handling (decode, encode, convert, …) video and audio files. It is used by many commercial and free software products, including Blender. The core is the FFMPEG program, together with a video & audio player (FFPLAY) and a stream analyzer (FFPROBE). 1. Generate testfiles Sometimes you need a test video or test image with a specific resolution, duration or framerate. You can first try with ffplay to view the test video.

item.title: Color Picker
item.description: Did you know that Blender has five different color pickers? No? You can choose between them in the Preferences panel (Edit » Preferences » Interface). They look rather intuitive to use (see Figure 1). But even for this simple tool, several questions arise and trying to answer them will get you very fast into deep Blender space! Figure 1: Color picker. The default option is shown at the left.
